issue.title: Archive files glob "**" works for .tar.gz but not for .zip

milestone.title: v1.0.0
milestone.description: Intended to be the first stable solution, with most of the features implemented.

issue.body:
If I add files with "**" glob to an archive, the .tar.gz adds them but not the .zip.

```
archive:
  files:
  - README.md
  - LICENSE
  - NOTICE
  - examples/**

  format_overrides:
  - goos: windows
    format: zip
```

The workaround is to use single "*" globs and add individual directories:

```
archive:
  files:
  - README.md
  - LICENSE
  - NOTICE
  - examples/main/*
  - examples/secondary/*
```

- OS: linux
- OS version: Linux foucault 4.16.14-300.fc28.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jun 5 16:23:44 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- GoReleaser 0.76.0

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm trying to send binaries to a local [`hoarder`](https://github.com/nanopack/hoarder) instance.

Without a `PUT_HOARDER_SECRET` environment variable `goreleaser` complains:

```
reason=put section 'hoarder' is not configured properly (missing PUT_HOARDER_SECRET environment variable)
``` 

But if I set the variable the output looks like this (`--debug` flag provided):

```
...
    SIGNING ARTIFACTS
       skipped                   reason=artifact signing is disabled
    CREATING DOCKER IMAGES
       skipped                   reason=docker section is not configured
    RELEASING TO ARTIFACTORY
       skipped                   reason=artifactory section is not configured
    RELEASING WITH HTTP PUT
    RELEASING TO S3
       skipped                   reason=s3 section is not configured
    RELEASING TO GITHUB
       skipped                   reason=release pipe is disabled
...
``` 

It just does nothing. There is no request sent to the http server. I even implemented a simple http-server to log the request but there is no http request made.

**To Reproduce**


**Expected behavior**

Do a http PUT request with the configured parameters.

issue.title: Disabling "release" pipe empties the git-inferred project name

milestone.title: v1.0.0
milestone.description: Intended to be the first stable solution, with most of the features implemented.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Disabling "release" pipe empties the git-inferred project name:
1. `{{.ProjectName}}` will be empty.
2. NFPM will fail complaining about the empty package name


log sample:
```
...
    LOADING ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES
    skipped                   reason=release pipe is disabled
...
    LINUX PACKAGES WITH NFPM
    release failed after 6.43s error=invalid nfpm config: package name cannot be empty
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. do not set `project_name` in `.goreleaser.yml`
2. add `disable: true` under `release`
3. run goreleaser

```yaml
# project_name: xxx
release:
  disable: true
```

**Expected behavior**
`ProjectName` will be inferred from the git project name. You can tell that from the result packages. NFPM will succeed if you enable it.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- OS: linux
- OS version: Linux hostname 4.18.16-arch1-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat Oct 20 22:06:45 UTC 2018 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- GoReleaser Version: 0.92.1, commit 8eaca29766e2f635bb68994111ccefd6ee342e14, built at 2018-10-31T03:41:03Z

**Workaround**
Explicitly set `project_name` in your `.goreleaser.yml`

issue.title: sign: should use env variables

milestone.title: v1.0.0
milestone.description: Intended to be the first stable solution, with most of the features implemented.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Within the sign step the environment variables set in the env section are not considered for expanding.

**To Reproduce**

Use custom env variable within ags of sign step. For e.g.:

```
sign:
  signature: "${artifact}.sig"
  cmd: openssl
  args: ["dgst", "-sha256", "-sign", "${SIGN_KEY}", "-out", "${signature}", "${artifact}"]
  artifacts: al
```

**Expected behavior**

I would expect that goreleaser expands the content with the variable set in the environment section.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Linux
- OS version: Linux Volta 4.4.0-18362-Microsoft #1-Microsoft Mon Mar 18 12:02:00 PST 2019 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- GoReleaser Version: latest

**Additional context**
I created a custom build which enables this by adding all environment variables from `ctx.Env` to the map which is used to expand variables. 

I've added the follow snippet at this [location](https://github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser/blob/d8818c2683daf01cde35ee194215cfc38a0da550/internal/pipe/sign/sign.go#L89). I would like to receive comments if this is considered as it should work ins this way, then I would create a PR.

```Go
for _, e := range ctx.Env.Strings() {
	item := strings.SplitN(e, "=", 2)
	env[item[0]] = item[1]
}
```

Thanks in advance.

issue.title: It tries to add README.md when format: gz
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Format gz (gzip) only accepts one file. When it's specified in the archive format, it tries to add README.md (and possibly README* LICENSE* LICENCE* and CHANGELOG*, I haven't tried it).

**To Reproduce**

Have a project with a README.md file, and add a goreleaser which archive format is "gz"

```yaml
env_files:
  github_token: ~/.config/goreleaser/github_token

before:
  hooks:
    - go mod tidy

builds:
  - id: gkup-cli-build
    main: ./cmd/gkup-cli
    binary: gkup
    ldflags: -X github.com/Miguel-Dorta/gkup-cli/internal.Version={{.Version}}
    goos:
      - darwin
      - freebsd
      - linux
      - windows
    goarch:
      - 386
      - amd64
      - arm
      - arm64
    goarm:
      - 5
      - 6
      - 7

archives:
  - id: gkup-cli-archive
    builds:
      - gkup-cli-build
    format: gz
    name_template: "{{ .ProjectName }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}{{ if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}"
```

**Why do you use "{{ .ProjectName }}" instead of "{{ .Binary }}" in the name template?**
According to the [documentation](https://goreleaser.com/archive/):
```yaml
# Archive name template.
# Defaults:
# - if format is `tar.gz`, `tar.xz`, `gz` or `zip`:
#   - `{{ .ProjectName }}_{{ .Version }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}{{ if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}{{ if .Mips }}_{{ .Mips }}{{ end }}`
# - if format is `binary`:
#   - `{{ .Binary }}_{{ .Version }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}{{ if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}{{ if .Mips }}_{{ .Mips }}{{ end }}`
```
I also see it a little weird, but ok.

**Expected behavior**

It should build and compress the binary without trying to add any more files

**Actual behavior**

It fails with the following message: 

>  release failed after 1.61s error=failed to add README.md to the archive: gzip: failed to add README.md, only one file can be archived in gz format

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Linux
- OS version: Linux platon 5.6.7-1-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Apr 23 10:50:31 UTC 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- GoReleaser Version:
version: 0.132.1
commit: 244ca69a09735fdd712bd802ff4aefb5d5da60cd
built at: 2020-04-23T02:12:42Z
built by: goreleaser
